content.question:
The rhythm is three measures long. The first and second measures are given below.

Which of the following rhythmic patterns is played in the third measure?

choices.label: One measure in treble clef. Eighth D5, sixteenth notes B4, E5, quarter note D5.
One measure in treble clef. Quarter D5, sixteenth notes B4, E5, eighth note D5.
One measure in treble clef. Dotted eighth D5, sixteenth B4, eighth notes E5, D5.
One measure in treble clef. Sixteenth notes D5, B4, eighth E5, quarter D5.

content.answer: One measure in treble clef. Eighth D5, sixteenth notes B4, E5, quarter note D5.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
